hjb.HjbProblem#

class hjb.HjbProblem(dimension: int, order: int, max_min: str, optim_method: str, info: int, theta: float | int)[source]#

Class for all the parameters of the specified problem.

This class is responsible for the discretziation and the book keeping of the parameters of the problem.

x_min#

Lower bound for the first spatial dimension. Default: -1.0

Type:

float

x_max#

Upper bound for the first spatial dimension. Default: 1.0

Type:

float

q_min#

Lower bound for the control values. If the control values is not bounded in the -infinity direction you have to specify it as an empty list. Default: -1.0

Type:

float

q_max#

Upper bound for the control values. If the control values is not bounded in the +infinity direction you have to specify it as an empty list. Default: 1.0

Type:

float

T#

Endtime of the time dependent problem. Default: 1.0

Type:

float

f#

User defined function for the volume force.

Type:

Callable

u_D#

User defined dirichlet boundary conditions. If the problem is one dimensional you have to specify a list with two entrys where the value on left bound is in the first entry of the list and the value on the right bound is in the second entry.

If the Problem is two dimensional you have to specify it as a list with four numpy.ndarrays in the following order:

  1. Top boundary conditions

  2. Right boundary conditions

  3. Bottom boundary conditions

  4. Left boundary conditions

Type:

Callable

u_0#

User defined initial conditions. Have to return a numpy.ndarray of the appropriate size.

Type:

Callable

order#

Order of the highest derivative term

Type:

int {1, 2}

dimension#

Spatial dimension of the problem

Type:

int {1, 2}

max_min#

Either max or min depending wheter you have a supremum or a infimum in your HJB equation. This option is only necessary if you don’t specify a user defined optimization routine.

Type:

str {"min", "max"}

theta#

Theta parameter in the time discretization

Type:

float or int [0, 1]

tol#

Termination criterium for the howard algorithm

Type:

float

max_iter#

Maximum amount of iterations allowed in the howard algorithm

Type:

float

tol_gmres#

Tolerance for the GMRES solver for solving the linear system of equations

Type:

float

info#

Information level of the solver. Supported are level 0 wich only writes wheter the howard algorithm terminated or not and the norm of the sucessfull or unsecussfull step. Level 1 writtes the norm of all the iterations in the Howard algorithm

Type:

int {0, 1}

n_x#

Number of points in the equidistant spatial discretization in the first dimension

Type:

int

n_t#

Number of points in the equdistant time discretization

Type:

int

optim_method#

Optimization method wich shall be used

Type:

str {"user_func", "brute_all", "brute", "scalar"}

n_q#

Number of points in the equidistant controll discretization

Type:

int

q_opt_user#

User suplied optimization routine

Type:

Callabel

dx#

User suplied calculation of the terms infront of the first order derivatives. Has to return a list with entrys of partial derivatives in the corresponding direction.

Type:

Callable

ddx#

User suplied calculation of the terms infront of the second order derivatives. Has to return a list with entrys of partial derivatives in the corresponding direciton.

Type:

Callable

y_min#

Lower bound for the second spatial dimension. Default: -1.0

Type:

float

y_max#

Upper bound for the second spatial dimension. Default: 1.0

Type:

float

n_y#

Number of points in the equidistant spatial discretization in the second dimension

Type:

int

sol#

List of the calculated solutions. Each element in the list is a numpy.ndarray with the solution at this time step.

Type:

List[ndarray]

q_opt#

List of the calculated optimal control values. Each element in the list is a numpy.ndarray with the solution at this time step.

Type:

List[ndarray]

x#

Spatial discretization of the domain. Each entry in the list is a spatial direction

Type:

List[ndarray]

dofs#

Number of degrees of freedom for the discretized domain without the boundary points.

Type:

int

t_d#

Discretized time dimension.

Type:

ndarray

h_t#

Step size in time.

Type:

float

h_x#

Step size in the first spatial dimension.

Type:

float

h_y#

Step size in the second spatial dimension.

Type:

float

Methods

check_input_and_discretize()

Function to discretize and checking of obviuos input errors

check_inputs()

Function to check for obvious input errors.

discretize()

Function wich discretizes the spatial, time dimensions and if necessary the control (discretizes the control only if it isn't specified)

get_non_bcs_ind()

Function to calculate the indices wich are not on the boundary

previous

hjb.optim_user_func

next

hjb.HjbProblem.check_input_and_discretize
